snippet: A leader who was a political prisoner took a moral stand in accepting six detainees. If others also stepped forward, it could hasten the closing of the prison.
abstract: Editorial applauds Uruguay's decision to take six Guantanamo Bay detainees, granting them refugee status; notes that transfer of prisoners marks largest reduction in number of inmates at Guantanamo Bay since 2009; contends that move may encourage other Latin American countries to welcome detainees, hastening shutdown of prison and drawing contemptible chapter of American history to close.
lead_paragraph: A leader who was a political prisoner took a moral stand in accepting six detainees. If others also stepped forward, it could hasten the closing of the prison.
